title: Wisdom's Invitation
shortSummary: Proverbs 9 contrasts the invitations of Wisdom and Folly, personified as women calling out to those who lack understanding. Wisdom offers life and blessing through reverence of the Lord, while Folly leads to death and destruction. This chapter highlights the importance of choosing the path of wisdom for a fruitful and prolonged life.

keyCharacters.name: Wisdom
keyCharacters.description: Personified as a noble woman who builds a house and invites the simple to gain understanding and life.

keyCharacters.name: Folly
keyCharacters.description: Personified as a foolish woman who calls out to the simple with enticing but deadly offers.

keyCharacters.name: Simple
keyCharacters.description: Those lacking understanding or discernment, whom both Wisdom and Folly seek to influence.

definitions.definition: A person lacking moral or spiritual understanding, easily led astray.
One who mocks or ridicules wisdom and correction, resistant to instruction.
A reverent awe and respect for God that is the foundation of true wisdom.
Symbolic of completeness and stability in the structure Wisdom has built.

outline.heading: Wisdom’s Prepared Invitation
outline.description: Wisdom is portrayed as having built a well-established house with seven pillars and prepared a feast, inviting the simple to partake and gain understanding, symbolizing the readiness of God’s wisdom to nourish and sustain life.

outline.heading: The Call to Choose Wisdom
outline.description: Wisdom urges the forsaking of foolishness and emphasizes the benefits of living wisely, including increased life and favor, while warning that scorn and rejection of wisdom bring consequences borne alone.

outline.heading: The Folly’s Deceptive Invitation
outline.description: Folly is depicted as a loud, ignorant woman who entices the simple with stolen pleasures, but her guests ultimately face death and destruction, illustrating the deadly consequences of rejecting wisdom.

application: Heed the invitation of Wisdom by seeking God’s guidance daily through prayer and Scripture study.
Avoid the company and counsel of scoffers and fools who reject correction and lead to spiritual ruin.
Embrace correction and instruction with humility to grow in wisdom and understanding.
Recognize that true wisdom begins with the fear of the Lord, leading to a blessed and prolonged life.

keyVerses.text: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.
keyVerses.significance: This verse establishes the foundational principle that reverence for God is essential to gaining true wisdom.

keyVerses.text: Forsake the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.
keyVerses.significance: A clear call to reject folly and choose the path of wisdom for life and blessing.

keyVerses.text: But he knoweth not that the dead are there; and that her guests are in the depths of hell.
keyVerses.significance: A solemn warning about the deadly consequences of following the seductive but destructive path of folly.
